title: Some workflow
text: document aims providing workflow may arise use impactR. Let’s load package. , let’s use ‘airports’ dataset package nycflights13 impactR’s functions written assumption provided data may coerced tibble, since extensively use tidyverse. Let’s sat survey sheet composed : First thing ‘survey’ used elsewhere: separate type column.
code: # If you haven't done so  # devtools::install_github("impactR) library(impactR) #install.packages("nycflights13") library(nycflights13)  # Load dataset in environment data(airports)  # Show the first lines and types of airports' tibble airports ## # A tibble: 1,458 × 8 ##    faa   name                             lat    lon   alt    tz dst   tzone     ##    <chr> <chr>                          <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <chr>     ##  1 04G   Lansdowne Airport               41.1  -80.6  1044    -5 A     America/… ##  2 06A   Moton Field Municipal Airport   32.5  -85.7   264    -6 A     America/… ##  3 06C   Schaumburg Regional             42.0  -88.1   801    -6 A     America/… ##  4 06N   Randall Airport                 41.4  -74.4   523    -5 A     America/… ##  5 09J   Jekyll Island Airport           31.1  -81.4    11    -5 A     America/… ##  6 0A9   Elizabethton Municipal Airport  36.4  -82.2  1593    -5 A     America/… ##  7 0G6   Williams County Airport         41.5  -84.5   730    -5 A     America/… ##  8 0G7   Finger Lakes Regional Airport   42.9  -76.8   492    -5 A     America/… ##  9 0P2   Shoestring Aviation Airfield    39.8  -76.6  1000    -5 U     America/… ## 10 0S9   Jefferson County Intl           48.1 -123.    108    -8 A     America/… ## # … with 1,448 more rows survey <- tibble::tibble(   type = c("select_one faa_list", "select_one name_list", "decimal", "decimal", "integer", "gps", "select_one destination_list", "select_one tzone_list"),   name = colnames(airports),   label = colnames(airports) ) # All are already defaults apart from 'col_to_split' survey <- survey |>     split_survey(     col_to_split = "type",     into = c("type", "list_name"),     sep = " ",     fill = "right")

title: Some workflow
text: order check outliers, ’s main one can use, check two types outliers: Deviation mean IQR deviation.
code: # Helper to get numeric columns numeric_cols(airports) # Get all numeric columns : it includes for example numeric enumerator ids or gps locations ## [1] "lat" "lon" "alt" "tz" numeric_cols(airports, survey) # Check for numeric columns using the survey sheet. ## [1] "lat" "lon" "alt" # Get IQR outliers (1.5 default rule) outliers_iqr(airports, col = alt,times = 1.5,  id_col = faa) # id_col is usually "uuid" with Kobo ## # A tibble: 165 × 3 ##    faa   question_name old_value ##    <chr> <chr>             <dbl> ##  1 1G4   alt                4813 ##  2 36U   alt                5637 ##  3 4U9   alt                6007 ##  4 6S0   alt                4492 ##  5 A50   alt                6145 ##  6 ABQ   alt                5355 ##  7 AIA   alt                3931 ##  8 ALM   alt                4200 ##  9 ALS   alt                7539 ## 10 AMA   alt                3607 ## # … with 155 more rows # Get standard deviation outliers outliers_sd(airports, alt, times = 3, id_col = faa) ## # A tibble: 47 × 3 ##    faa   question_name old_value ##    <chr> <chr>             <dbl> ##  1 36U   alt                5637 ##  2 4U9   alt                6007 ##  3 A50   alt                6145 ##  4 ALS   alt                7539 ##  5 APA   alt                5883 ##  6 ASE   alt                7820 ##  7 BCE   alt                7590 ##  8 BJC   alt                5670 ##  9 BKF   alt                5662 ## 10 BSF   alt                6190 ## # … with 37 more rows # Create the full log of outliers of all numeri columns make_log_outlier(airports, survey, id_col = faa, tzone) ## # A tibble: 282 × 14 ##    id_check tzone       faa   question_name question_label why   feedback action ##    <chr>    <chr>       <chr> <chr>         <chr>          <chr> <chr>    <chr>  ##  1 outlier  America/An… 6K8   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  2 outlier  America/An… ABL   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  3 outlier  America/An… AET   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  4 outlier  America/An… AIN   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  5 outlier  America/An… AKP   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  6 outlier  America/An… ANI   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  7 outlier  America/An… ANV   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  8 outlier  America/An… ARC   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ##  9 outlier  America/An… ATK   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ## 10 outlier  America/An… AUK   lat           lat            Outl… Fill in  check  ## # … with 272 more rows, and 6 more variables: old_value <dbl>, new_value <chr>, ## #   type <chr>, other_parent_question <chr>, other_new_value <chr>, ## #   checkdate <chr>

title: Authors and Citation
text: Guillaume N (2022). impactR: Ease IMPACT's data database officers woRk. R package version 0.4.12, https://github.com/gnoblet/impactR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {impactR: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk},   author = {Noblet Guillaume},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.4.12},   url = {https://github.com/gnoblet/impactR}, }

what: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk
title: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk
text: Ease IMPACT’s data database officers woRk impactR started simple project: mainly reminder totally-perfectible functions used made go Burkina Faso mission 2021. still rough draft, useable. Yet, becoming somehow bigger make data officers database officers daily R work easier follows: utils.R: functions used everyday basis: import .csv .xlsx files, recode NAs, get column names starting pattern, etc. monitor.R: functions produce logs help monitoring data collection (logical tests, outliers, answers) clean.R: use logs clean dataset (update values, delete surveys) analysis.R: calculate optimums, weighted proportions interactions, pivot tables reports plots.R: plot functions themes (colors, fonts) maps.R: utils (e.g. ease bbox) themes (mainly using tmap) still need consolidate parameters log checks, (lot) documentation write. Specs: mainly using Kobo collection tidyverse, srvyr, janitor, tmap requires R 4.1+ (mostly native pipe |>).

title: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk
text: can install last version impactR GitHub :

title: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk
text: version 0.4, contributions go minimal complete commits good practice. dev branch used . introduce tidy eval wherever makes sense plotting functions add (re) count columns post-cleaning multiple choices columns simple choice’s column MSNA analysis tools : roster (education, demography, WGI), weighting functions, analysis functions Split big mess several consolidated small packages : viz one, analysis one cleaning one (maybe?).

title: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk
text: Shiny app cleaning monitoring (French now) whose repo collectoR.

title: Ease IMPACT's data and database officers woRk
code: box::use(impactR[...]) ## basic example codes and uses (not run!)  ## Import a csv file with clean names and clean types #import_csv("data.csv")  ## Get colnames for sector foodsec whose variables start with "f_" #tbl_col_start(data, "f_")  ## Bbox with a buffer (useful to add compass, scale_bar, legends to a map) #buffer_bbox(admin1_sf, buffer = 0.05)  ## Make an outlier log for all numeric variables in the data.frame/tibble #make_log_outlier(rawdata, survey, id_col = "uuid", cols_to_keep = c("uuid", "i_enum_id"))  ## Make a log based on logical tests, outliers and "other" answers #make_all_logs(rawdata,  #              survey,  #              check_list, #              other = "other_",  #              id_col = "uuid",  #              cols_to_keep = c("uuid", "i_enum_id"))  ## Recode parent "other" from a well-filled cleaning log #recode_other_parent_from_log(data, log, id_col = "uuid")  ## Calculate weigthed proportion for shelter type by group (e.g. administrative areas or population groups) #svy_prop(design, group_cols = c("admin1", "group_pop"), "s_shelter_type", na.rm = T, level = 0.95)

text: solely written mimic variables names produced Kobo use `janitor::clean_names()`. Example : *variable* multiple choice variable *variable_choice1* count variable choice 1.

Simple bar graph — reach_flip_bar
code: reach_flip_bar(   .tbl,   x,   y = NULL,   f = NULL,   c = NULL,   facet = NULL,   pal = NULL,   reverse = F,   discrete = T,   alpha = 0.7,   width = 0.3,   scale_percent = F,   position = "fill",   dodge_width = 0.5,   fill_name = NULL,   fill_levels = NULL,   fill_labels = NULL,   theme = NULL,   title = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL )

title: Simple bar graph — reach_flip_bar
text: .tbl tibble x x variable y y variable f fill variable c color variable facet facet variable pal palette name `impactR::reach_pal()` reverse color reversed? Default FALSE discrete color pal used discrete scale? Default TRUE alpha Color's transparency width Bar's width scale_percent axis labels scaled nice percent? Default FALSE position Either 'fill' 'dodge' dodge_width position 'dodge', dodge width fill_name Legend title fill_levels Levels order fill labels fill_labels Fill labels theme Theme name. Default NULL reach theme. values "simple", "void", "bw", "minimal" title Title xlab X-axis label ylab Y-axis label

code: reach_hist_bar(   .tbl,   x,   y = NULL,   f = NULL,   c = NULL,   facet = NULL,   pal = NULL,   reverse = F,   discrete = T,   alpha = 0.7,   width = 0.3,   scale_percent = F,   position = "fill",   dodge_width = 0.5,   fill_name = NULL,   fill_levels = NULL,   fill_labels = NULL,   theme = NULL,   title = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL )

title: Simple bar graph — reach_hist_bar
text: .tbl tibble x x variable y y variable f fill variable c color variable facet facet variable pal palette name `impactR::reach_pal()` reverse color reversed? Default FALSE discrete color pal used discrete scale? Default TRUE alpha Color's transparency width Bar's width scale_percent axis labels scaled nice percent? Default FALSE position Either 'fill' 'dodge' dodge_width position 'dodge', dodge width fill_name Legend title fill_levels Levels order fill labels fill_labels Fill labels theme Theme name. Default NULL reach theme. values "simple", "void", "bw", "minimal" title Title xlab X-axis label ylab Y-axis label
